job_title: Summer Student Worker in Northfield, MN
pros: I am a student worker for the summer. The work is not hard and my employer is understanding and lenient with time entry.
cons: There is not many cons!

pros: There are no benefits that can out way the cons.

pros: Well managed, amazing students, great benefits, lots of freedom in your teaching

pros: Great School with somewhat good pay compared to its peers

pros: This position has flexible hours, minimal formal time commitment, and gives you great opportunities to develop communication and organizational skills

pros: Getting paid while going to school

review_title: Wonderful job, poorly run pro-staff office
pros: The students are wonderful and the work is meaningful. Guaranteed single rooms too.
cons:
Extended annual training is unusual among peer intuitions, as is the below-boarding-cost payscale.
The professional staff running the department are... clearly the kinds of adults who would actually take a full-time in Northfield, MN.

pros: Really amazing and caring supervisor and fun team
cons: There weren't drawbacks to this position.

pros: Get to organize fun events and interact with many people.
cons: Small town, weather can be a mixed bag.

pros: Meh ok place to work.
cons: Meh, no complaints to note.

review_title: It is a good place to work.
pros: Good working environment. I think.

review_title: Works at cave and wall in rec center

pros: The people are nice and good at their job.

pros: Some jobs are engaging and pleasant. Pay is reasonable
cons: Many jobs are tedious and tiring.

pros: Good benefits, work life balance, smart and dedicated students

Super Friendly Staff

job_title: Assistant Professor in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Students are fantastic and eager
cons: Culture is toxic and prestige-obsessed

review_title: Being a French teacher assistant at Carleton helps you maintain your French while working with nice people.
job_title: French Teacher Assistant in Northfield, MN
pros: The students are talented, engaged and hardworking. Carleton college is a very friendly environment. The technology and equipments for learning languages and just about anything are diverse and make learning and teaching rich  experiences.
cons: The Minnesotan weather can get you at times. It gets extremely cold. Also Carleton is in an isolated and small time. If you are more used to life in the city, this might be a big challenge, especially if you plan to stay there for long.

pros: Carleton is generally a pretty chill and flexible employer. I have held multiple campus jobs as a student, and they are never too strict as long as you have a decent performance.
cons: I cannot think of many cons. If I have to say one, it would be the competitiveness of jobs, but maybe that's just because I have applied to many random jobs and gotten more rejections.

pros: Wonderful students and colleagues. Great benefits. The college works hard to be progressive. My position includes 8 weeks off in the summer. My director is hands off, yet supportive...and there is lots of room to be creative and autonomous in how I get my work done.
cons: Not much upward (or lateral) mobility. High demand for mental health services with limited capacity to meet that demand (like all university settings currently).

pros: The office that I worked with was great to work with. My supervisors and coworkers took the time to get to know me and I spent a lot of time with them outside of work as well. The supervisors of my office valued my ideas and considered whenever they made a decision.
cons:
- The experience with various work-study opportunities varies greatly depending on which office you are placed in. Some offices are perceived to have better management and supervisors over others. 
- Some offices have a high turnover of staff

pros: You get paid double the campus wage for teaching courses, you can choose whether to do homework or climb during your shifts
cons: You have to walk to the rec which can be a pain during the winter, the air conditioner makes your hands freeze if you aren't climbing which makes typing difficult

pros: The sense of community is incredible, and it's easy to feel like you're doing good work. The area (northfield) is gorgeous, also.
cons: The only con I can think of is that you won't want to leave. I can't imagine working with such supportive people anywhere else.

review_title: A great place to learn and teach.
pros: The students and faculty are always hardworking and engaged which always makes working with them worthwhile. Working with students that are intellectually curious make you a better learner but also a better teacher. You never know what questions that students will ask, and I find this incredibly exciting.
cons: Despite being a cute town, Northfield can feel a little isolated. Also, it would be nice to see more investment in purchasing some new instruments in the science departments.

pros: There are many options for students who choose to find a job on campus. Generally, supervisors are (and are required to be) very understanding of academic commitments that may interfere with student employment.
cons: The hourly wage for students is quite low, and students are limited to working 10 hours per week, with some rare exceptions.

pros: Student who are employed are allowed to build their work schedules around their academic schedule, and the supervisors are very flexible when allotting shifts.
cons: It may be difficult to switch jobs or positions throughout the academic year if you choose to do so. Furthermore as the academic year progresses it may be difficult to fit in student employment with academic work.

pros: I was very happy to work for hte college. Through my position, I met many iteresting people and the jobs themselves were not that difficult.
cons: During one of my jobs at the college, there was a professor that was slightly difficult to work with. However, everything turned out fine.

pros: flexible schedule, friendly staff, open
cons: pompous professors (at times), long hours for my position

pros: I've had 4 campus jobs while at Carleton and loved all of the except for working at the dining hall! Supervisors mostly work with you to schedule decent hours; I was almost always able to get 10 hours a week. If you can avoid good working for food services freshman year, you've got it made.
cons: Food services is not the most glamorous job, but even then, supervisors are awesome.

pros:
Surrounded by friendly students who constantly engage in intellectual debates 
Faculty is superb and friendly, and extremely helpful to everyone
cons:
The health benefits is nonexistent unless you work 40 hours a week
Northfield is a small town with nothing much to offer for entertainment

pros: When you work your student job, it takes money off your tuition. Overall it's a pretty good deal for students.
cons: There is no opportunity for advancement for students. Whatever job you have is going to pretty much be your job until you graduate

pros: High academic standards, inspiring leadership, beautiful campus, competitive salaries for most positions
cons: Difficult to attain longer tenure unless one fits in with the culture, meets high (sometimes quite biased) expectations and performance evaluations, and 'goes along with the flow' politically.  Lack of transparency and communication in various management positions.

review_title: Wonderful college!  A great place to work.
job_title: Assistant to Chair, Department of Economics in Northfield, MN
pros: Top notch college with all the "niceness" you can imagine.  Very easy to tackle new tasks with well equipped support and thought out ideas.  Students are incredible, faculty are as well, and dedicated to making a difference.
cons: weather can be a challenge a few times throughout the year, but is understandable.

pros:
-Simple work(cleaning equipment,  counting gym users, answering questions)
-Able to do homework
-Many Supervisors are accessible and tolerant
-Easy to sub for other workers and get more working hours throughout the term
cons:
-Work can be monotonous
-May be tough to find a cover for your shift if its a morning  shift

pros:
-continuous opportunities for professional growth through Learning and Teaching Center
-supportive faculty and staff
-ability to use college facilities, such as library, gym, swimming pool
-opportunities to go to free cultural events, many of which are open to faculty and staff
cons: I really cannot think of anything negative about Carleton College. I had wonderful experience working there.

pros: Great environment to work in. Friendly staff and nice location. The job is really fun.
cons: Sometimes there are lots of interviews lined up all at once, which can appear to be overwhelming. The job requires Saturday morning work

review_title: It's a great place to work and study!
job_title: GIS Lab Assistant in Northfield, MN
pros: Recently raised hourly pay for student workers; anyone is guaranteed a job.
cons: It's hard to fit in any work with the academic course load.

job_title: Prospect Research Officer in Northfield, MN
pros: Valued for your work. Professional level of employees with can-do attitudes. Beautiful location. College is on Forbes list!
cons: None at this point in time.

job_title: Assistant Systems Administrator in Northfield, MN
pros: Good student jobs, helpful career center
cons: Pay has thankfully gotten a hike but it is very much still student wages for student workers

pros: Access to facilities, access to classes, good benefits, kind staff, kind students
cons: Some management issues depending on your employer

job_title: Digital Humanities Associate in Northfield, MN
pros: Great professors - collaborating with them and learning about their research is awesome.
cons: As a student worker, you're not paid much.

pros: Very friendly and amiable atmosphere to work and grow.
cons: It can be a bubble at times.

pros: Flexible hours and friendly people
